block.p: Monisha Kapur, a daughter of Sudesh and Krishan Kapur of West Orange, N.J., is to be married today in Jersey City to Debasish Mishra, the son of Sanjukta and Sirish Mishra of Troy, Mich. Pandit Chaitanya Agnihotria, a Hindu priest, is to officiate at the Hyatt Regency Jersey City.
Ms. Kapur, 31, works in New York as a buyer of women's shoes for the stores of Macy's East of Federated Department Stores. She graduated from Rutgers University.

Monisha Kapur, a daughter of Sudesh and Krishan Kapur of West Orange, N.J., is to be married today in Jersey City to Debasish Mishra, the son of Sanjukta and Sirish Mishra of Troy, Mich. Pandit Chaitanya Agnihotria, a Hindu priest, is to officiate at the Hyatt Regency Jersey City.
Ms. Kapur, 31, works in New York as a buyer of women's shoes for the stores of Macy's East of Federated Department Stores. She graduated from Rutgers University.

The bride's father, who is retired, worked in New York as the controller at the Indian mission to the United Nations. Her mother is a consumer service manager in West Orange for Organon, a pharmaceuticals unit of Akzo Nobel, the Dutch drug and chemical maker.

Mr. Mishra, also 31, is a candidate for a master's degree in public policy and management at Carnegie Mellon University. He is a founder and the vice chairman of the South Asian American Leaders of Tomorrow, an advocacy group in Washington for South Asians in the United States. He graduated from the University of Michigan. His father is an engineering supervisor in Troy for an automotive seating unit of Faurecia, an equipment supplier based in France.
